name: Hope of the Valley Rescue Mission Help Center
address: 6425 Tyrone Ave, Van Nuys, CA 91401, United States
reviews: They tell you you have to make a appointment but never answer the phone so how do you make a appointment they do nothing to help the homeless cause first you got to get down there and then they make you come back for a appointment and by that time there is no help left to be had the workers here should be fired there a joke
Just don't talk to anyone. Great place to shower in the morning. Monday's and Fridays they'll give you socks.

In the posting it says they closed at 3 pm n the security didn't acknowledge me at the gate I ask a worker he said it was closed there not doing there job n turning people away from a simple hygiene same like the one in Sherman way

I would like to take the time to express my heartfelt appreciation and gratitude that I received from Hope The Mission. Approximately 30 days ago I was totally crestfallen, because I had a major financial setback that had me on the verge of becoming homeless. Nonetheless, I reached out to Hope The Mission on Tyrone/Victory Blvd. located in San Fernando Valley, and they provided the hope that I needed. With that being said, Mrs. Kay, Mrs. Kimberly and Mrs. Liz advocated to assist me with my rental expenses. I've always said, it takes a Village to assist with a crisis, and they were that Village that came to my rescue. Notwithstanding, thank you Mrs. Kay for being a conduit that lead to Mrs. Kimberly P. and Mrs. Liz V., because without their tenacious spirit and incessant drive, I would not have been approved for assistance. You all were a raw, uncut and polished Gem that exuded and illustrated a ray of hope and light that will forever shine. Again, thanks a million times over for all of you guy's support. Respectfully, P.T.

Great service for goups. And hot foods are very homey but the outside services are bad. who arrests inconocent homeless people? Overall some of the management in the housing programs are rude and need to be more settling.

name: The Salvation Army Bell Lighthouse Corps
address: 5600 Rickenbacker Rd, Bell, CA 90201, United States
reviews: Un reposeable girls over there.I went to pick up a person who needed dialysis and lived in building 5600. I asked the young girl sitting behind the counter to call the person, but she said that I was not responsible and that the patient had to come and show up on his own. Time: 5 am on 1/24/2025 building 2a - b
I was a client there years ago I got a section 8 apartment in San Pedro Blue Bell shelter sadly though I may be needing their help again soon. So glad they're still around.
Great place and a big help with people who are struggling during the holidays

This place is out of control!!! Security guards there do what they want to do there. Very unprofessional security guards corrupted with the homeless inside. It‚Äôs inside connection between the homeless that‚Äôs   the show there. Unsafe Unsanitary conditions the homeless that don‚Äôtlike u or offer u will pour simen in the lotions spreading disease that‚Äôs have. There‚Äôs Favoritism in the inside. I don‚Äôt know why they help support the shelter they let drug dealers sell drugs in the property police don‚Äôt do nothing about it. The The counselor is supposed to be there to help you they‚Äôre not there to help you. When there‚Äôs a problem. No ever reports problems with others there. I was the first one. Nothings has changed I left the shelter because I was tired of people fighting with me

They are awesome beyond amazing, even on  my low days. Being a veteran, being a person struggling with my own disability I feel seen, and receiving the help I  need... despite my conscious efforts of struggling with what normality they understand better than any place that I have ever been. They help people on such a deeper level that I am not sure that they even know or notice. Well, I noticed, and I am so eternally grateful. Staff here are amazing, inspiring, patient, endearing, fun, funny, direct, and well defined. I've never fought so hard for my sobriety as I continue to do every day. Awesome case managers, and the security is squared away. They are a collective of realism led by an honor roll staff of great people. The church and counseling offered are so beyond exceptional. They want and allow people to find their purpose and reason to stay sober and excel. Thank you. ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Mary's Mercy Center Inc
address: 641 Roberds Ave N, San Bernardino, CA 92411, United States
reviews: Thanks to the Virgin Mary and the staff here, I can dine in such a sacred environment. It is an awakening of my soul. I will live and work well, and I will love the people around me well!

They served free lunch during the week i think  except on Friday's. The food is ok and Sometimes you get good food  especially on holidays like Thanksgiving or Christmas or especial occasions when local government officials San Manuel Casino chain stores like Target Walmart food 4 less stater brothers.. Are planning to visit Mary's Table to see if there donations are helping the community. The food is üëçüëã..  I wish the food was the same for the entire year no just to make them look good pretending they served the good food every day to the community in need of food including the homeless people who don't have a voice.
If they truly care about people -- why do they have their guests stand in the sun with no shade?
Amazing group of volunteers of all ages. Feeding the homeless and people in need. What a beautiful blessing to be here to help out. God said feed my people.

I am beyond grateful that I found this program. Mary‚Äôs Haven has saved my life. LITERALLY. I‚Äôve been here for 7 months now and I‚Äôve been clean and sober for 7 months ( Thanks to Mary‚Äôs Haven) And the person I am today is unrecognizable. If it wasn‚Äôt for Ms Wilkins coming in and turning this place around for the better. I know I wouldn‚Äôt of made it this far without her. The amount of work, love, and patience that Ms Wilkins and Ms Barbara put in this place every day is magnificent.
I came into this program with absolutely no life skills, no ambitions, no money, poor parenting skills, nasty eating habits, no communication skills and poor cleaning habits. I can full whole heartedly say that The staff at Mary‚Äôs Haven help me step by step to change into a better person and a better mother. They put their heart and soul into this job. Helping those who are willing to make a change and still willing to help those who aren‚Äôt quite ready by pushing them into the right direction. I can‚Äôt forget to mention the love they have for each and every child that comes in with no hesitation. They make the children feel loved. My son absolutely loves all the staff here. For the first time in my life I now have a savings account and a plan for my future. I am a prime example that this program does work. I am excited to see what my future holds after completing this program.

name: St. Vincent's Cardinal Manning Center
address: 231 Winston St, Los Angeles, CA 90013, United States
reviews: This place has a lot of rules. Coffee is served at 6am. There are two big screen TV and the morning news are shown. It can be difficult to enter their programs. Overall it is a good place to start one's day.
Moved in last Tuesday so far I like it , really clean ,charging stations, day room with big tv, vending machines , clean showers and bathrooms and big dorm upstairs. 3 meals a day. Security on site.
Great place, staff is friendly and the case managers very respectful and resourceful.

This place is a lifesaver! It's a process to get in (you need to take a TB test then orientation) but I had a bed and breakfast for the next 6 months while I went to school and they refer me to another program that got me an apartment for $50 a month!
I've been in my own place for 4 years! All I have to do is just let them visit me for 5 minutes every month and that's only to check up on me to see if I need anything like a haircut voucher or a box of food.
The only thing is that the curfew is at 7:30pm and you have to leave after breakfast (which is 7:30pm, if I remember right), unless you work or go to school. If you're on drugs then you probably won't make it, even with those simple rules (from what I saw). But if you're serious about getting on your feet and getting some stability, then St. Vincent is the perfect place for you!
Shout out to my caseworker Sharen Cervantes! Thank you for all your help, I'll never forget you!

After completing 2 residential programs I had no where to go because money was short. St. Vincents Cardinal Manning Center took me in and I was able to continue my job and save a good amount of money. Progress not perfection is what it's all about. Clean, safe, and great staff always willing to help you succeed.

name: Interfaith Community Social Services
address: 18500 Striker Ct, Sonora, CA 95370, United States
reviews: I recently visited interfaith in Sonora,ca. A lady named Deborah informed me they could help me get a battery for my RV I just needed to bring a quote for the battery so I went to Napa Auto parts. Then returned to Deborah office whom upon my first visit stated that she to was once homeless so I thought she cared about me and my struggles since my of wife's  recent passing. 33years married to the love of my life. But thanks to living in toulomene county where most of the citizens are a product of in breading it really should come as no surprise to me that she is a liar and has no interest in truly helping anyone. So beware if you ever need help I would not recommend going to them for assistance. Thanks to Sargent passuqie (misspelled) touolueme county sheriff giving me a ticket for out of date registration. fine $160.00 which I just bought in January of 2024  and registration cost $785.00 the registration should not have been due until January of 2025. But thanks to the seller having lied about his wife having paid to keep vehicle on non-op. Again a citizen of toulomene countys (embreaded population) I am done with living in a society that has no compassion for anyone but them selfs,where lying is okay and the welfare system is a joke and if your a Senior Citizen in this county (good luck) because no one cares about you not even the ones displaying the cross that my Savior Jesus Christ died on as part of their business advertisement is all fake misleading which offers nothing more than creating a false sense of caring to for it's citizens. As for the Sargent for toulomene county again (my guess is a product of embreading) hello new State Law effective 2024 States it is illegal for officers to ticket a person for simply having expired tags for 60 days but on the start of the 90 day they can legally issue you a ticket the exception is if a driver has committed some other type of motor vehicle infraction can they issue a ticket.. know the law if your in a position of enforcing the laws.  Oh it's no superise that Debroah and The fine Sargent choose to profile the less fortunate by demonstrating what can happen when you are a product of embreading in toulomene county.  That's it I'm done you win have lived a fair life but I can't take it anymore so I'm going to say goodbye and pray for God's forgiveness for my selfish actions. Both Deborah √†nd the good Sargent should not be in a position where they can cause people to loose hope and cause people to take their lives. Especially in positions where they have a duty to protect and serve the citizens (weather imbread or not) all people deserve better treatment no matter to their situation may be good luck and good bye oh I know who cares anyway right.

The receptionist is unhelpful and lazy, she does not want to help you in anyway to point you in the right direction if you‚Äôre out of state and need help with finding how to get papers for your case. The receptionist is rude, does not know how to do her job correctly or efficiently. If I could give zero stars I would. This place is a waste of time due to the rude receptionist who won‚Äôt let me speak to a manager. And she does not say her name when she answers the phone. Find another job this field your in is for people who need to take care of court cases and be pointed in the right direction if you guys don‚Äôt offer a service you should be knowledgeable of the area and services around you. Quit your job.
Very friendly environment lots to offer for the needy great place overall

Interfaith. Good people, I have nothing bad to say about their help or organization. They help so many people in need. Plenty of parking and wheelchair accessible. They deserve more than 5 stars for all the help they provide to our community! A Shout out to all their employees and volunteers, Thank you so much for your dedication and hard work! God bless you all.

A great community social service center. Give them a call. They offer food, many different clothes and legal advice. If you need help with any of those services they will help at no cost. They are volunteering based and you may take a few hours helping out too.

name: David Lambert Community Center
address: 347 W Jackson St, Sonora, CA 95370, United States
reviews: Great place for the homeless and less fortunate. Food, computers,drinks,tv and great volunteers!

It's great that there is such a provision to feed those in need or for the public to just drop in for a quick bite and to meet new people.
Thank you!

Great place for recommendations and great resources. I visit this place at least 3 times if not 5 times a week. I love the friendly staff and they are always there to help you with what you need if they can! I recommend the drop in center to anyone. This place has saved me many times when i was in need. I love this place hands down!

This is an important and wonderful place for disinfranchised people to gather. It is a day home where they can talk, relax, eat, watch TV, play cards,, read  and get out of the cold.

The community has been very good to the center and have helped support it. Bravo to the Lamberts. The center was named for their son, David.

This place is so helpful. And humanizing.  Mrs. Lambert runs a tight ship but with a big heart.  If you need a place to rest your feet, eat something, or to find resources to help whatever situation has brought you here, this is the palce. There is a small tax of helping lend a hand in keepig the place.  Clean a dish. Sweep the floor. Push in a chair. Carry in some goods. It goes a long ways.

name: ATCAA | Amador Tuolumne Community Action Agency
address: 427 CA-49 #302, Sonora, CA 95370, United States
reviews:
I recently applied for services and they were very quick to make a decision. Great job!
Thank you!
Great people. Great asset to our community.

No one answers the phone. You have to leave a message and someone MAY call you back if they feel like it.  Asked me a lot of time personal questions about my brother and then said they couldn‚Äôt talk to me. What?!! My Questions were general and could be applied to anyone. Had my disabled brother call and he is still waiting for a callback after 2 weeks. Very disappointing üòû

This organization is wonderful. I got help with renting a room a few years ago then recently got help again when I moved. You can get help every few years if you take time to gathers your facts and papers, proof , or whatever they require. It does depend on if they have funding at the time. The staff could use a bit of sensibility training, they are great but can make a person feel bad about their situation at times. But I appreciated their help.

Heron and Joel did and awesome work in our home!! Very polite and knowledgeable with what they were doing.
Thanks guys for all the good work.

name: Connections Emergency Shelter
address: 5069 St Andrews Rd, Mariposa, CA 95338, United States

name: Betty's Blue Angel Village
address: Eureka, CA 95501, United States
reviews:
Don't live here if ya wanna actually live.   It's like a animal exhibit more than anything.   We were kicked out when we were doing very well, then Betty tried to take it all away.  Kinda funny.

Need help? Aww poor thing, let me tease you with my wealth - betty

Back in school Betty spoke about many things, and she was very uplifting.  But that was flushed down how she treated us.

Like labrats

Then out because I got a car, and Betty didnt like that !!

I understand needing to impose restrictions, but Betty was mentally and physically abusive to me and others - kicking some people out randomly without discussing what they did wrong, while desperately helping her few select favorites. Severe abuse of power and resources. If you find yourself in this area and needing help, please go to the Mission or call for emergency help instead.

Betty is as selfish and crooked as they come.  Her foundation is a joke and she lives high on the hog from the public's contributions while sharing the bare minimum with the people she's sworn to help. Treating them as poorly as some would treat a rat invading their sanctuary.

This place should be called "Betty Chinn Rules Enforcement Foundation" because housing people takes a backseat to zero tolerance rules enforcement.  I didn't even break them, and they threw me out. Plus they refused my reasonable request for accommodation under ADA, and kicked me out for having the issue I was requesting accomodation for. After they threw me out I asked, in writing, if they'd let me use their toilets, and they ignored me. I am nobody to them. When I protested that they were throwing me out over their mistake and not mine, the attendant laughed at me and ridiculed me and started provoking me and got me worked up then started filming me and suggesting I get violent. I left screaming, then screamed and cried uncontrollably outside their gate for hours, and they never even so much as offered me a cup of water.

Three stars because the rec room was nice and the portapotties were clean.

Betty is the greatest. This location is her "container village". It is basically a bunch of shipping containers that have been converted into makeshift living space. Beats sleeping on the streets though, especially when it is raining. Located conveniently next to the Dept of Health and Human Services on Koster Street.

name: Eureka Rescue Mission
address: 110 2nd St, Eureka, CA 95501, United States
reviews: Basically a prison with no rules or security. I saw people assault staff and other people there including myself. They actually tossed me out after I got out of the hospital, even though I didn't do anything. Food sucks as well as sleeping on the floor on a mat right next to a hundred other people and they wake us up 6 and then make you sit outside in courtyard rain or shine. Basically hell on earth.
Very positive place to stay where you arent judged and are given stability while trying to get back on your own feet!
They do such a great job feeding people in Eureka. Donations are always welcome.

I am impressed with the caring people who run the Mission.  They are doing all they can to help the homeless and addicted.  A family member has been living there off and on for years.  This place has such a heart to help the homeless.   We need a few more of these in the area.....God bless the people there.

Nice to see the remodel currentl(2024) for the women & children's side to a bunkbed dorm style downstairs(Finally) they can fit almost 3x the amount of women they can compared to when I stayed there couple months(09/2021-12/2021) until I got exited. Don't ask why, Idk why. Not the point. Point is the women's mission part is doing an upgrade should've been done years ago. Let's just say many many MANY things people that aren't from Humboldt get shocked when they find out things more than not counties in Cali, Majority of Humboldt County 'Help' (ambulances, sober living transitional housing, etc) is privately funded. Then again it is faith based so it's makes since a church probably has it under its wing. Since I'm not a religious person when I stayed there the directors would give use the choice to step out during services. If we would like to sit outside, so that was legit due to alot of places that are faith based they force their 'clients' to attend them, mandatory. Otherwise, you were living there much longer. It was sad due to the fact that some religions find sacrilegious to attend or even think about a diff. Religion. So honestly that's the only reason I could stay there because if it was forced upon me, that's just not cool. I'm just grateful they let me stay a few months when I needed.

name: Redwood Community Action Agency
address: 904 G St, Eureka, CA 95501, United States
reviews: If I can give zero star, I would! The most frustrating and nonsensical process of calling in to get heat assistance. The line is just constantly busy; from 9 in the morning til noon non-stop. Why even tell people to call in when they‚Äôre just going to take the phone off the hook. Absolutely crazy! This is a federally funded program. Who do I call to make a complaint?
The woman wasnt clear at all on what i needed to bring as far as documentation.  Driving all the way from hoopa. I felt like i got treated like garbage by that woman for racial reasons.

None of these nonprofits want to help with the fix LES SCHAWB has put me in.
Be careful who you give to when you're doing good.
Maybe it's because I'm a disabled senior.
James Joseph Mallett

A local community service organization that provides a range of services for low and moderate income people living in Humboldt County.  The old house they are located in is a beautifully maintained example of high quality  Victorian architecture.
The people are so helpful. They try to make things better for everyone, even during these trying times. So glad we have this program and the people who help so much.

name: Building Bridges - Homeless Resource Center
address: 1045 S State St, Ukiah, CA 95482, United States
reviews: Great services including showering, laundry,anything donational via ein such as clothing food and healthcare they also have beds and small cabinet chest type shelving for people staying the eve but also help counsel with local street meds  medical and referrals for offset housing wich helps to get you on track and off tracks and out of trouble  please keep yourself and belongings safe
A great place to be if you happen to be homeless in our great city. Fantastic staff, great transient population, even a parking lot. Sometimes they replace the A/C filters. Enjoy!
I hate it it's not a good place for homeless family with kids plus no privacy and alot of ppl that use drugs or drink alcohol
This place SAVED MY LIFE .........
Do NOT have your mail delivered to this location. They will steal your property and then deny ever receiving it.

name: Mendocino Coast Hospitality Center
address: 101 N Franklin St, Fort Bragg, CA 95437, United States
reviews: Unfortunately when public entities mix with tax advantaged status and a boondoggle approach terrible things happen. Lets begin with the Hospitality Centers admin Address. Best use stipulates on advantages of low income housing and correct use of assets. Hospitaly Centers morally and ethically should remove all Admin. Offices at downtown Hotel and use  properly to house and assist lower income earners. TOTAL FAiLURE  govt.   woldn‚Äôt expect any different.!!
Great people, they helped us get a place to live! We were the first success story
Best place for resources for the homeless and the homesteaders if you're new to the area or if you just need resources their kid friendly non-judgmental and they have all the hookups to the community
In over 1600 miles of travel Fort Bragg was the first community that showed an active interest in helping me get off the road and street.

I'm from the east coast and mentally disabled, greatest place on earth for a transient and someone in need of a lil human love :) keep up the great work

G.Guthro.

name: Hospitality House
address: 237 N McPherson St, Fort Bragg, CA 95437, United States
reviews: This program gave me my life back!  I have stayed sober, im employable and am now living in in a home that my husband and i can raise our son.  Thank you To everyone at the Hospitality House for believing in me when i couldnt.

Pretty nice place. The services are in back, you sign up on a sheet and wait your turn. Showers are 10 minutes, hot water included and they give out soap and loan out towels.

If you want to do laundry COME BEFORE 11AM. Ive waited over 2 hours to even get around to starting a load.

Meals Daily 3-4,
Showers & Laundry Mon-Fri 9-2

Meal lately was BLT and curly fries. Just need to sign up on a list, don‚Äôt need to say last name on any of it.

Admins treat the guests like inmates. Not cool. They're supposed to help people in need. Not punish them. Making them feel less than. New rules make people stressed and depressed. Although long time managers F and Sh are great! Very good managers. Very good people. They are encouraging and supportive. they are understanding and also firm when they need to be. Those two really belong there. They know how to manage efficiently and very well for all who stay and work there

Stayed At The House On & Off. By far only 1 Manager was rude & unpleasant, Luckily she got fired so no more worries ;) Also always good food thanks to their two best cooks (you guys know who you are) It has its ups & downs. But when there its all about structure. So if your acting out of line and they call the cops on you it doesn't make anyone snitchs. Its called policy. I'm giving Hospitality House 4/5 Stars. My main reason of 4 instead of 5 is that they need to start testing everyone that comes in there and start monitoring those who sneak out past 9pm curfew. The favoritism needs to stop too. It's good to have favorites however business is business. Tracy knew that as a supervisor. Just cause he was friends with certain people. Doesn't mean you get to go out late at night and have fun, or smoke in the bathrooms, etc. Other than that the supervisors aren't the problem its the residents. I can say a lot of names, but i'll leave it there.

They let u take showers 9 to 3 and serve a hot meal Monday thru Friday
REALLY NICE PEOPLE WORK THERE
Oh ya AND they let u do laundry

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
address: 2840 Hulen Pl, Riverside, CA 92507, United States
reviews: It's up to you. Change can start here. They are helping me find new directions in life. Able to take slower clean bedding ok mattresses. 3 meals and a Excellent case manager. Staff friendly but follows rules to a T! 60 day program. If not willing to commit to rule and curfew please don't waste their time. There is too many people that really need this program.
They don‚Äôt care enough to answer the phone or call you back! That says a lot!

Path of life ministry is helpful and caring organization . The family shelter helped me and my daughter have a safe place to stay when I was homeless, I got a job through path of life and a referral for housing , it took for me to just follow the rules and regulations and be determined to end being homeless.i am very thankful for path of life services and staff. I now live in a beautiful luxury apartment, ALL THE HONOR AND GLORY TO  GOD FOR BLESSING ME WITH PATH OF LIFE MINISTRY.   SINCERELY, MICHELLE

I have never know about these kind of places. Before if it wasn't for the kind  support from the Path of Life social workers. Who have made it easier for people like me to find help when out on the streets. To find that they're are others who work everyday to find solutions. In everyday situation with the friendly hospitality that they have done. With all who have found the kind conversation that the misfortunate have come to have. Thank you again for all you have done for us.

I was a resident once and had a great experience. I was able to work at a warehouse near by and save my money. The staff was caring and hard working. They truly only wanted the best for us and where a great example for me. I was able to take this experience and work it to my favor. I found a permanate transitional home for men due to the fact i no longer wanted to be homeless or around any kind of drug environment. Path of Life was the place that opened my eyes to ways of my mistakes.

name: Operation Safe House
address: 9685 Hayes St, Riverside, CA 92503, United States
reviews: i was just here recently, i didn‚Äôt think it was going to be bad because my mom is a foster parent and treats the kids extremely well. but i was wrong not to judge. some of the staff are good at doing their job but the other half are extremely unprofessional. While we were supposed to be ‚Äúasleep‚Äù i heard staff talking about the other clients that were in there with me. they were also talking about past clients. also while we were watching a movie the male teacher there Mr. O cut off the movie and was being aggressive too the client that put it on saying it was satanic and it‚Äôs a sin and god is going to punish her. keep in mind that the movie we were watching was hocus pocus 2 which is a pg DISNEY movie!

Horrible program. I hope they aren't receiving county funds from Riverside and if they are - they should be yanked immediately.

A friend of mine was having a mental health crisis last night and I wanted to reach out for resources and different options other than calling police or seeking a 5150 WIC hold.

While using the text-based resource seeking option, the operator asked:

"Is he in immediate danger?"

I replied,
"No"
"911, police and 5150 Wic are not necessary"

They replied,
"Then finding him a therapist" [sic]

I asked,
"Is that a suggestion or a question"

No further responses were received. Shame on you for being rude and inconsiderate to someone seeking mental health help. Not everyone wants to call 911, have authorities in their home or be placed on a hold. Sometimes people need compassion, encouragement and help making the best decision for their mental health.

I hope that someone never finds themselves alone, seeking help and makes the terrible mistake of contacting Operation Safe House.

Disgraceful and pathetic.

The safe house is staffed with great people. The staff is always welcoming new clients to work with to see that they get placed in the right home. There are many activities to keep the clients busy and the facility is very clean and organized. It‚Äôs such a joy witnessing the great care that is displayed in the Safehouse. I feel at home when I am serving (volunteering) at the Safehouse.

I'm not a big fan of this place. I personally think it's ran poorly. They do not cross their T or dot I. My son ranaway from my home and went here. He didn't want to follow the rules of my house. Some staff is much more effective and efficient than others. My own son said other boys try to push you around here. I personally do not reccomend this place.

Amazing street team. One of the best i have ever worked with. They help you when you truly need it. Im honestly so happy with the help osh does. 10 stars if i could give it that. I would recommend this safe house to any teen wanting to get help off the streets

name: Path of Life Ministries Family Shelter - Riverside, CA
address: 2530 3rd St, Riverside, CA 92507, United States
reviews: Don‚Äôt go here , staff rude, just a bunch of tweakers, security guards be mad asfc when u don‚Äôt wanna talk. There‚Äôs other places that will actually help u. Whoever owns this place your a disgrace to America period

I was supposed to get my id from here but it never came and they said they sent it back. If there really helpful if have my id or they would send it to where I'm at now. How are they helpful to me?? Really. Thank you but much improvement is needed. And the janitor is an absolute dirtbag bully. He turns up on all kinds of people and bully's all kinds of clients. It's racism and he should be kicked to the curb. He does it to all kinds of people. A lot. Than the staff has his back when he is way wrong. He is destroying people's lives ( not mine I'm always good) but others yes. It's complete racism someone needs to look into it it's sick. And I've heard from staff that they have let people die there on purpose. I don't know if that's true but the staff said it and i think that's morbid. I love helping people so when people who are supposed too do like that it makes me vomit in my mouth. Sick. Janitors a dirtbag needs reprimand. Also he calls people out to fight than calls the cops and kicks them out like i said sick.
Many years ago I received services from this homeless shelter ministry they are truly a blessing if you need housing this is the place to go.
Deplorable..I'd take my chances on the street
The staff are friendly and helpful. I've always had positive experiences with them.

name: Plumas Rural Services Inc.
address: 711 E Main St, Quincy, CA 95971, United States
reviews: These wonderful people helped me turn around from wronged and homeless into a housed successful adult I couldn't do it with out these precious organizations such as this one helping find my feet again, as I've said wonderful people, friendly, always smiling, and always there to reach a hand of help when you are the furthest down on your knees that you've ever been these people will be there for you I promise! üôè‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è God bless you all üôè

Great at first‚Ä¶ then pretty much told me i wasnt abused badly enough to get their services anymore and their shelter was too full for me and my daughter to stay there. Come to find out from someone who is there, the house is not full. Is it better to go back to the abuser or just be on the streets with ny child?

Can't say enough about how the services here have helped me so much.  Have to give an extra shout out to a lady that is such an angel.  I was blessed to have her helping me threw the last year. My disaster case manager. Mrs Nancy.
Went to the historic Chinese cemetery behind this place. Pretty cool. Had lunch with a friend. Love cemeteries.
I go to this building for my WIC appointments and both the WIC and transit staff are friendly, helpful, and welcoming.

name: Plumas Crisis Intervention
address: 591 Main St, Quincy, CA 95971, United States
reviews:
Monday through Friday open ??? I don't recall, but closes at 5pm.

Food supplies: canned, dairy and frozen.

Computer use and some clothing along with some classes for Life Improvement.

This building opened recently after a fire destroyed the old one several years.

Everything is State of the Art.

The staff are extremely helpful and caring.

I would give a minus review if I could. I called for information on trapping a stay cat.  Officer Sighs? (Don't know how to spell it) Was dismissive, mocking, and then laughed at me before I hung up. When i said I would take three stay to animal control after tapping it.
Always helpful and full of knowledge! We love all the assistance they provide to our small town!
Have been awesome helping myself‚Ä¶..

name: Oroville Rescue Mission
address: 4250 Lincoln Blvd, Oroville, CA 95966, United States
reviews: Don't come here. Everything you own will be stolen by staff. The people saying you're good. Staff makes money off of things they steal.

This shelter is ok, but very cramped in the womens dorm. But is also very slow trying to find housing and services for the homeless. My friend is still there. She's been there 4 or 5 years. Thinking about taking her to the Jesus Center or Torres Shelter here in Chico. I got into my apartment within 6 months  after I moved to Chico County. Hopefully they can help her better.

The staff are rude and just to eat they want to subject you to a search like they are TSA they wouldn't let me eat a hot meal because I refused to remove my boots on their nasty floor. They treat everyone who walks true the door automatically like a criminal. If you need a place to stay I advise camping rather than being humiliated and talked to like your retarded or a child.

I called to help a friend who needed to stay here. I talked to three different female workers who all stated that even though the check in time was 3-5pm that they never turn anyone away and that women that need shelter can come at anytime. I show up to drop off my friend and the women who working the early day shift were super rude and kicked us off the property. I tried to explain that we called the day before and the information we were told but the women working at that time kept cutting me off, saying, I don't care what anyone said to you, get off the property. I tried to explain that my friend isn't safe on the street because she is disabled and unable to defend herself or run away from any possible predators. The lady working told me that she didn't care, that check in time is only 3-5pm and to get off the property or she would call the cops.

We were not being loud. We drove into the property in a quiet little car, no music playing or anything. We called when we got there. Got shut down and hung up on the phone first and then were sitting in the parking lot trying to figure out where to go when the women worker came out and started demanding that we left the property. That's when I tried to explain the situation and the people we previously spoke with.
Very helpful staff and they are very friendly and compassionate. They guide you on the right path by providing helpful resources.

name: SHELTER, Inc.
address: 310 Beck Ave, Fairfield, CA 94533, United States
reviews: This place is very good they feed you lunch breakfast dinner and snack time.you get your own bed and locker.

What I‚Äôve read in these reviews are exactly why my daughter will not go there. She needs help but this doesn‚Äôt seem to be the place at all.
We need a place that will truly help our unsheltered population. People need to know how to work with mentally ill and homeless population. Not all homeless are drug addicts!
They need advocates that will help,
I didn't go to get service, but to pick up some items from my dead relatives.. very caring and friendly staff. Thank you and God bless you.

This is a homeless shelter shaped like a small apartment building with a gated parking lot & small playground. Residences are sepatated by men on 1 side & women with chidren on other side. Sustainable Solano held an event here planting fruit trees to give the occupants free fruit in future.

The abuse culture among men toward women is strong here. When you take it to male staff they side with the abusers and keep them on. I‚Äôm here recovering from a mental breakdown down that was caused by abuse from my family, and the team member that abused me was very much aware of that. I didn‚Äôt have a breakdown but a very exhausting meltdown as a result of how ‚ÄúReese‚Äù treated me simply for asking with help getting my locker open. He knowingly chose to treat me the same way my family did.

Walter tried to tell me that I could‚Äôve handled the abuse better, and that he was concerned about the grievance because he feels Reese is one of his best workers and friends. Just plain evil.

I caught a cold last week, and it‚Äôs symptoms worsened because Walter didn‚Äôt want to provide a towel for me to dry the floors so I could close the door at night after a roommate decided to mop.
He said he claimed that if he did provide, I‚Äôd just ‚Äúcome back the next day, and the next day, and the day after that!‚Äù I was trying to make conditions better for myself and my dorm mates, but instead was subjected to the biting cold. I don‚Äôt understand why people like him work in places like this.

I‚Äôve seen more respect for animals at the pound! The woman-hating needs to stop, because nobody talks to the men like that around here.

name: Opportunity House Homeless Shelter
address: 267 Bennett Hill Ct, Vacaville, CA 95688, United States
reviews: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!!!! ALL AROUND JUST HORRIBLE!! People were rude and snappy didn't help for nothing. If you don't like your job then quit. This is supposed to be a place for people to come that need help. And there was none of that. They don't care what anyone's situation is if your Homeless out in the streets even with kids or none of that. I waisted everything coming to this place only to be turned down and NO HELP WHAT-SO-EVER!!!!üëé I Hope and Pray to God I will never have to experience the way I was treated here ever againüôè

This place a blessing everyone that works here really cares and tries to help you succeed. It's perfect for anyone trying to turn their life around especially for those of us fresh out of rehab that would've been forced back into the environment that took us down. It's the perfect combination of program and freedom to help you get back on your feet without overwhelming you and making you feel like you went from residential to residential. You still have your freedom with some exceptions the classes aren't too much and their helpful It's understandable a place as good as this would have such a waiting list. There should be one of these in every city

Being here was a blessing, It was a rough start trying to adapt to rules and having to do things a different way that you're not used to but you learn from it if you let yourself learn from it, i miss this place and actually miss doing my early morning chores lol, my case manager Donna was awesome the first person to ever motivate me and push me to actually get things done that i needed to get done, I came here being homeless, So thankful that I met jen that picked me up to bring me here after talking to her since i was 16, thanks to opportunity house i got my voucher and met awesome people and felt safe, this was one of the best chapters in my life since i didn't grow up in a safe peaceful environment, let yourself learn and be willing and this place will be a blessing for you as well

Dismissed me after months of working the program successfully. If you have pre-existing conditions make sure you won't be written off as a "liability" after months of immersion in their program. Great people, just be careful of seeking this program if you are disabled.

Fell upon hard times and a difficult situation in May 2015; stayed there for 2 wks w/my two sons before I was inexplicably & unfairly told to leave for absolutely no good reason apparently. For a place that is supposedly trying to 'help' people, they are ridiculously intrusive on your privacy, as well as demeaning and disrespectful to you as a person. The vibe & atmosphere there feels very much like minimum security jail. Not the feeling one should have to experience when one is trying to move on and better their lives. A person named Tamara was the head when I was there; a very unfriendly and rude individual. I got the feeling that she does not like people of color, particularly black people. I understand we all have hard times & situations that may fall upon us, but I would definitely avoid this place like the plague if at all possible.

name: The Salvation Army of Solano County
address: 1200 Missouri St, Fairfield, CA 94533, United States
reviews: How does a volunteer get told not to volunteer  with no explanation.  I have asked  for an explanation and can't get one. I've reached out to major no response.this is like at school. A child is bullied and told to stay away from the bully. The bully then controls everybody else. While the one bullied stands alone and says" I should never have said anything." Now I'm alone with no support. No explanation for why I am being devolunteered. Can somebody help with this?
Very helpful people on everything: food for thanksgiving and Christmas and every day. Blessed them for the assistance to the public.
In order to get a dessert, a person usually lines up an hour before. If not for their help, many families would go hungry. God bless The Salvation Army!!!

Salvation Army‚Äôs decision to turn this location into a free food handout has had more negative impact on the deterioration of downtown Fairfield than any other single factor. Salvation Army is a bad neighbor and they have turned a once charming area into a blighted homeless magnet. This spills onto Texas Street and to business offices nearby.  They refuse to even speak with residents about the rampant crime on their property and its effect on downtown residents, not to mention the strain on local law enforcement who have to respond to many calls there. This location is inappropriate for this service when we are working so hard to revitalize our struggling downtown business reputation. Residents find boxes and bags full of discarded food all over downtown. Just because this service is needed does not mean Salvation Army should not be clean, safe, and responsible providing such services. Shame on them!
Went there for help with PGE, they don't do that but they were helpful in locating someone who could., They even helped me with food. Bless all those who donated

name: Path of Life Ministries Community Shelter
address: 2840 Hulen Pl, Riverside, CA 92507, United States
reviews: It's up to you. Change can start here. They are helping me find new directions in life. Able to take slower clean bedding ok mattresses. 3 meals and a Excellent case manager. Staff friendly but follows rules to a T! 60 day program. If not willing to commit to rule and curfew please don't waste their time. There is too many people that really need this program.
They don‚Äôt care enough to answer the phone or call you back! That says a lot!

Path of life ministry is helpful and caring organization . The family shelter helped me and my daughter have a safe place to stay when I was homeless, I got a job through path of life and a referral for housing , it took for me to just follow the rules and regulations and be determined to end being homeless.i am very thankful for path of life services and staff. I now live in a beautiful luxury apartment, ALL THE HONOR AND GLORY TO  GOD FOR BLESSING ME WITH PATH OF LIFE MINISTRY.   SINCERELY, MICHELLE

I have never know about these kind of places. Before if it wasn't for the kind  support from the Path of Life social workers. Who have made it easier for people like me to find help when out on the streets. To find that they're are others who work everyday to find solutions. In everyday situation with the friendly hospitality that they have done. With all who have found the kind conversation that the misfortunate have come to have. Thank you again for all you have done for us.

I was a resident once and had a great experience. I was able to work at a warehouse near by and save my money. The staff was caring and hard working. They truly only wanted the best for us and where a great example for me. I was able to take this experience and work it to my favor. I found a permanate transitional home for men due to the fact i no longer wanted to be homeless or around any kind of drug environment. Path of Life was the place that opened my eyes to ways of my mistakes.

name: Operation Safe House
address: 9685 Hayes St, Riverside, CA 92503, United States
reviews: i was just here recently, i didn‚Äôt think it was going to be bad because my mom is a foster parent and treats the kids extremely well. but i was wrong not to judge. some of the staff are good at doing their job but the other half are extremely unprofessional. While we were supposed to be ‚Äúasleep‚Äù i heard staff talking about the other clients that were in there with me. they were also talking about past clients. also while we were watching a movie the male teacher there Mr. O cut off the movie and was being aggressive too the client that put it on saying it was satanic and it‚Äôs a sin and god is going to punish her. keep in mind that the movie we were watching was hocus pocus 2 which is a pg DISNEY movie!

Horrible program. I hope they aren't receiving county funds from Riverside and if they are - they should be yanked immediately.

A friend of mine was having a mental health crisis last night and I wanted to reach out for resources and different options other than calling police or seeking a 5150 WIC hold.

While using the text-based resource seeking option, the operator asked:

"Is he in immediate danger?"

I replied,
"No"
"911, police and 5150 Wic are not necessary"

They replied,
"Then finding him a therapist" [sic]

I asked,
"Is that a suggestion or a question"

No further responses were received. Shame on you for being rude and inconsiderate to someone seeking mental health help. Not everyone wants to call 911, have authorities in their home or be placed on a hold. Sometimes people need compassion, encouragement and help making the best decision for their mental health.

I hope that someone never finds themselves alone, seeking help and makes the terrible mistake of contacting Operation Safe House.

Disgraceful and pathetic.

The safe house is staffed with great people. The staff is always welcoming new clients to work with to see that they get placed in the right home. There are many activities to keep the clients busy and the facility is very clean and organized. It‚Äôs such a joy witnessing the great care that is displayed in the Safehouse. I feel at home when I am serving (volunteering) at the Safehouse.

I'm not a big fan of this place. I personally think it's ran poorly. They do not cross their T or dot I. My son ranaway from my home and went here. He didn't want to follow the rules of my house. Some staff is much more effective and efficient than others. My own son said other boys try to push you around here. I personally do not reccomend this place.

Amazing street team. One of the best i have ever worked with. They help you when you truly need it. Im honestly so happy with the help osh does. 10 stars if i could give it that. I would recommend this safe house to any teen wanting to get help off the streets

name: Harrison Hope Center (Mercy House)
address: 420 Harrison St, Corona, CA 92878, United States
reviews: Thank you for being open 24hours.cause I'm literally stuck outside right now lol after being 2months pregnant üòÖ I have no car. Soooo uhh I'ma just come tomorrow and I pray y'all have to for me

name: WomanHaven, A Center for Family Solutions
address: 510 Main St Suite 106, El Centro, CA 92243, United States
reviews: This horrible organization helped a man file a restraining order against a woman that is the true victim of this man that is making false accusations against this female. Now the female can‚Äôt seek help from this organization due to conflict of interest. I guess this organization should be called Menhaven from now on!

Going back to 2016 & 2017 I don't even know where to start . But I will say I could never forget your names martha cabay , Sonia, Gina etc etc the list of woman that torn me apart during my process during my healing from domestic violence was awful . I have came so far now and I have open my eyes in a lot of things that was against the rules that they did to me I have so much more to say ! One day I will write about it .

I've had a frustrating experience at a thrift store, where an older gray-haired lady working at the register repeatedly has questioned me about the price of the merchandise I was trying to buy. She ended up trying to charge me more than what was shown on the sticker, claiming that the price was incorrect. As customers, we deserve to be treated with respect, and if the tag price is incorrect, the staff should report it to their supervisor instead of charging us more. Although the rest of the staff is great, I wouldn't recommend this thrift store whenever this particular lady is at the register.

Very rude staffs i met 3 rude staffs so far. Tanisha with the christmas program and shelter needs to ve replcae not reporting a very concerning case and giving ppl she knows priority and they have favortisms when it comes to gifts adoption program and even more concerning not reporting things that need to ve report i can easily proove that and letting clients from shlter come the next day or come after cerfuew hrs. This place is bot what they say rhey are.

Every time I go to this thrift store the old lady working at the register in the front charges me more then what their sign says, or if there‚Äôs a sticker with the price on the item she always charges me more. This has happened like 4 times already. The rest of the staff is GREAT but none of them work on the register. I would NOT recommend this thrift store at all.

name: CASA of Imperial County
address: 229 S 8th St suite b, El Centro, CA 92243, United States
reviews: Confidential. Treat you with respect and give you the time you need. They are very private about anything you need to talk about. They help out the community in every way possible. Especially the children.
A special place where people can do better and help community starting with the youth amazing leadership this agency does much for the community
Helps foster kids have advocates for them. And have some kind of stability
Great people doing wonderful things, for children in foster care!!

name: Calexico Neighborhood House (CNH)
address: 506 Fourth St, Calexico, CA 92231, United States
reviews: I call this morning to get help pay electric bill the that answer they couldn't help cause I had covid,to call when I don't have it ,well need the help she said to call else where ,but not their .
This place is such a need in the our valley. So grateful I can often refer clients there
This place helps people pay their rent. We rent rooms at our house and Neighborhood House pays the rent for these tenants.
A place where they make you feel welcome and they helped me alot here. Thanks
It is the most place to grow children with autentic care and wisdom.

name: 40 Prado Homeless Services Center
address: 40 Prado Rd, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, United States
reviews: Brand new building serving 100 people with 50 person overflow. Community partners such as Mental Health, Drug and Alcohol and Community Health Center use some of the offices. Hot meals provided, computers, laundry and showers available. Day center and detox coming soon.
I was very nice to eat and  meet new people @ the homeless shelter .

Dr. Willis Is the Best Doctor Bar None, I‚Äôve Ever Been To!  He's Totally Committed to All of his patients!!  In Short, He‚Äôs The  Best Doctor I‚Äôve ever been to!!!
Also, I go there to donate Clothing, Shoes to less unfortunate people. I've been there I know what it's like not to have anything and not to know where you're going to live or how it's even possible to get there? They're doing a great job at Prado I think. Everybody's got so much stuff nowadays, certainly wouldn't hurt anyone to start donating some things to this place for less unfortunate people that have nothing! I thank God that Prado was there when I needed them!

Needs to bring back no tolerance and stop with no proper training for staff to deal with the population of addiction and mental health. Clean it up bring chores back to everyday to create healthy habits for future independence. Structure consistency is needed in the world with empathy and compassion.

Dr. Willis is the best primary care doctor I've ever had.  He is very thoughtful with decision making and he cares.  It would be 5 stars if the wait-time wasn't so long.  I may be going to the Templeton office as well.  :)

name: 5Cities Homeless Coalition
address: Physical Address); Mailing, 100 S 4th St, Grover Beach, CA 93433, United States
reviews: This place is Amazing üëèü§©..so willing to solve a problem or more, make it seem like they all enjoy their jobs....They have patiently helped me...each employee I have met has been very resourceful... as I continue to go back !!
Help is available and the staff here has the info in one place. Treated with understanding and kindness they're really wanting to help get shelter.
I'll call them several times a day and they never pick up the phone they're really unprofessional. Hardly a business at all.

Great staff and wonderful resources. Dolores is super friendly and always attentive. I come in feeling down and she always makes my day a little better üíû
Thank you for having such amazing staff. Everyone at 5 cities homeless coalition are so wonderful. Thank you üôè Big shout out!!
Very impressive organization.  The staff are upbeat and extremely helpful.  I have rented my property to their clients and it has been very successful.  If I could give them more stars I would.

name: Community Action Partnership of San Luis Obispo County (CAPSLO)
address: 1030 Southwood Dr, San Luis Obispo, CA 93401, United States
reviews: I‚Äôm so blessed this program helps me to live thank you to all the staff for all your help and kindness

My step dad is an 84 yr. Living in a Mobil home park.  He now receives 24 hour care.  He no longer is physically able to work on repairs or pay for the help and appliances needed.  There are no other means to pay.for assistance.

CAP has come to our rescue, we have been with them a few years and had help with roof that had been leaking.  We had gone two winters without a heater until CAP replaced.  We got a new refrigerator, new shower heads, fire alarm, lighting, a new back door and new kitchen and bathroom floor repair due to water damage.  Just last week, our main bathroom floor was more severely damaged than when we first got the report.  Our bathroom floor looks brand new, what a fantastic job the CAP team did!

We just wouldn‚Äôt have been able to afford all those repairs and appliance purchases.

We were blessed beyond anything imagined and wish we could compensate the organization.  They work with funding issues and they worked hard for our case.  Saying thank you just doesn‚Äôt seem enough of what we have in our ‚ô•Ô∏è hearts.  Dell had stood out, we got to see him the most. He was a joy to have him return.   We were educated and never made to feel  guilt or shame for needing their services.  And knowing that others may have not gotten their needs met due to funding and all the work they helped us with.  The team every time were so kind and professional.

God love you all and if I was a fairy with a magic wand, all your needs would be met and to each of you who participated in our projects, you‚Äôd be heading to Vegas and the first machine you select would be sprinkled with fairy dust!  And that machine would be flowing with $$$ to help you make some dreams come true‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Hello just a note to thank Tom Potter and the rest of the staff at CAPSLO in San Luis Obispo for making it possible to transition from living homeless to having a new home. Everyone is so helpful and Tom really showed his commitment to getting us housed quickly by being available literally everyday on the phone and meeting with us at several properties until we found the right match. Thank you again Tom and Floyd, Tanda, and the rest of the crew at CAPSLO for a five star job well done.
Gave me the job and then revoked it. They have a lot of things rigged. Don‚Äôt recommend, it‚Äôs a waste of time.

There are some groups in this world that genuinely work hard for no other reason than to help people in need. This is one of the best examples of that. CAPSLO helps people in our community of all ages from all walks of life. I've had the pleasure of working with them only once but I fully intend on offering my time and donations again and again.

name: 14Forward
address: 1212 J St, Marysville, CA 95901, United States
reviews: They don‚Äôt provide much help other then a place to sleep the rooms don‚Äôt have any air conditioning and the bathrooms are Porta potties there‚Äôs no showers eather I‚Äôm not sure on how long you‚Äôre able to stay here I don‚Äôt see why anyone would want to stay there for a long period of time  Anyway unless you don‚Äôt have any other options

They do the best they can in a hard situation. The staff is very knowledgeable.the expectations of you as a client are reasonable and to the point to better yourself.it has a downside,this in place to make sure one doesn't become to comfortable and become unable to push through and forward.

No heat during the winter no AC during the summer room inspections behind your back when you're not there sounds like a wonderful place to live if you don't mind your privacy being thrown out the window the staff members are rude they treat people like they're better than the people staying thier.  you're staying in a little 12x12 shack that's meant to be in someone's backyard to hold their tools, not one or two people to live in

It's a shelter it's better then being stuck out in the weather and they help you get on your feet sounds like a good place to me there my be no air conditioning or heater but at least it's a safe place to be

Amazing place with amazing people. I am greatly appreciative for this place and the people involved with starting it.
First of its kind in California it is connected with the local Mission who offers us 2 meals a day and showers.
Case management to help house us. Health services and more

name: Twin Cities Rescue Mission
address: 940 14th St, Marysville, CA 95901, United States
reviews: Amazing staff, results are in and it is good news
The Mission is always accepting food, clothes, socks, mittens, toothpaste, deodorant and shampoo.

Its a homeless shelter so they don't really care about people. They only care about themselves. Though if you think otherwise they won't like it. Just a bunch of bums taking care of bums. So they aren't educated or aspire to be better. They are content with being who they are and in a world of content people. They are just another stone in the pond. Tonight I didn't have any protein for dinner. As they made the meal without any. They seemed to have made themselves lasagnas (the staff) and the cheese that they used could've been used for our meal. Yet they couldn't care less. If I had known that there would be no protein I would've got myself some from the store. I had no idea they were going to serve a meal that lacked nutrition at the most basic level so I'm actually surprised.

The staff of the Twin Cities Rescue Mission are amazing! This non-profit provides a critical service to the homeless in the Yuba-Sutter Community and recieves ZERO Funding from either County. They are a worthy cause if you are looking for a place to volunteer or make donations.
The people at the mission alot of them have drinking and drug addiction (iam also recovering from)need your prayers and the mission needs your money so lets help

name: Sacred Heart Community Service
address: 1381 S 1st St, San Jose, CA 95110, United States
reviews:
I went to Sacred Heart for the Turkey dinner help. I have to say I was overwhelmed by the kindness shown to me and to everyone around me. From the moment I was in line and through out the entire process each person assigned to assist me was just AWSOME. I felt very happy and I wanted to say THANK YOU to Sacred Heart and each person who made this possible.

A most special Thank you to all the VOLUNTEERS who guided me through the process. Your kindness I will always remember. God bless you all.  Happy Thanksgiving.

always loved sacred heart but  they used to be a lot better. More recently, service for food and clothes has been a struggle as lines are out of control. Honestly people there need it more than me so it's not worth the hassle The clothes closet is always a fun time for professional and recreational wear stillüíö
Very resourceful place...they have helped me out a few times.
It‚Äôs a good organization, nice people but the management is opinionated and if you do community service here it is better to not talk to anyone because you can get in trouble for it easily

Volunteered for Pack-A-Back. The staff work so hard and are all such wonderful dedicated people. It is just such a great atmosphere and makes you feel really happy to be a part of what they're doing. I highly recommend volunteering here

name: Family Supportive Housing
address: 692 N King Rd, San Jose, CA 95133, United States
reviews:
Great staff and service they provide.

It was 1st time I volunteered there came to know about the services they provide for needy people. The  staff were very nice and kind towards all. They have cleanly and pleasant environment inside.

I made and distributed goodie bags for childrens there as it was Diwali and Halloween Day. Again if I get chance I would definitely volunteer.

Cheer'SS  :)

I had a bad experience staying here with my lady that broke her ankle and my 3 lil kids first the staff working there are rude and my case worker Ann Gonzalez was unprofessional mean and had no patience she exit me and my lil family  in the rain because some other resident said I call her the b word the 3 times meals are just basic sandwiches and pastas and they don't want you to bring food from the outside but there a liquor store in the corner and the small street parking lot not safe little kids living there touch damage residents cars I want to thank Kevin,Ann Gonzalez and rest rude staff for wasting my time if you are a homeless family stay far away from this non organizations family shelter they don't give you housing vouchers and now I'm back in the streets homeless with my lil family I hope the supervisor or managers read my review this family shelter needs to be closed down üëé

It's a good shelter the workers are good workers as well just sometimes they can come off rude and not knowing what any one who stays in the shelter are really going through doesn't help. They got so strict and the manager Connie kicked my daughter out for he after school program and she doesn't even like school anymore he grades plummeted she was in TK and wasn't allowed back in now she's in kindergarten doing better since w e left but she was greatly discouraged when it happened last uear

This place is amazing, although you can't get into this family shelter without first calling here for you hotline. It's worth the wait to get into this shelter. They feed you three meals a day. The cook makes delicious food. There is homework club for kids. The rooms are nice like  a big hotel room .I couldn't be more thankful. Family shelter...the complete opposite of commercial street jail/shelter.

I appreciated almost everyone there for all their help. I really do Except for my case worker Caroline Hernandez who did NOTHING WHATSOEVER TO HELP. PRETTY USELESS AS A WORKER. Still hear she doesn't help much and more so now that everyone that worked there before is no longer there and shes alone. Good luck to everyone that has her as a worker. Ask for Nishma. She ACTUALLY talks to you AND TRIES to help.

name: LifeMoves | Montgomery Street Inn
address: 358 N Montgomery St, San Jose, CA 95110, United States
reviews: Good resource, good culture and great people. The director js helpful and generous with her decisions. The case managers are also helpful. Overall a good place to call home and search for a long term one while here. Lifeemoves here with lots of help and they make things happen for us.

My Experience Was The Best Experience I've Had All My Adult Life... I'm Truly  Grateful To Have Come To A Place I Actually
Called Home For 7 Months Because That's The Only Way Staff Would Have It.. I Can Say If U Don't Feel What I Felt During  Your Stay There Then Maybe  You Might Want To Consider Humbling Yourself A Lil More.. IJS
. I've Been Housed Now For A Week So On Behalf Of My 9yr. Old Daughter (Aminah) And My 5yr. Old Son (Mister) We Thank EACH n EVERYONE Of Staff And Residents Included For Helping To Bring Us Back Together In A GOD Bless  Place We Can Again Call Home...
I usually come here once a month to volunteer at the soup kitchen and I had good experience with the staff and the clients.

My brother was there for almost a year. Sometimes there was no cook. Food was cold and not good nor plentiful. The staff are rude and do not follow through. The inhabitants are given chores, like children, and this is criminal. They are called clients instead of residents. This place was formerly called MSI. My brother went there as a Veteran. Yet they accepted recent prison releases and the homeless, as their description now reads. An alternative place to live was found for my brother and he was told repeatedly for 3 months or more that he would be moving.The staff did not follow through until recently. I can give names if someone cares. He was also supposed to be helped to furnish his apartment. Yet, he was left on his own in a wheelchair to do those things himself..My brother is a very intelligent man. He recognized all the inadequacies. The place was dirty. At one point he was cleaning the toiletbefore he used it. He is in a wheelchairwith the use of one hand..

Director and Associate Directors
Have Agendas. Many empty Beds but have other Staff to say to the Public..."no beds available" All beds are paid for by The County. So the County is paying for empty beds. Case Managers will not tell you the whole truth or lie to Clients intentionally.  I cought my Case manager who has a Master's Degree...5 times lying to me by a County Worker.

name: Hospitality House
address: 1262 Sutton Way, Grass Valley, CA 95945, United States
reviews: Alot of these reviews must be fake. They are absolutely terrible with their rules here. I am currently in school and I can't even bring my laptop bag in here because they have to worry so much about all these drug addicts that they're helping out. Along with that there is a staff member who is really rude here

The hospitality house has been a very big help with finding me housing resources for myself and my dog. The staff are very nice and helpful the facility stays pretty dang clean.  I am so thankful for the hospitality house and all the staff that work there.  Thank you HH

Hospitality House turned us away in a time of desperate need - homeless and evening freezing temperatures outside. Hospitality House of Grass Valley was not hospitable. Our hope was high but now our hope is low and disappointment high.

Fantastic and compassionate staff!! When I had trouble making sense of my environment they ensured that I COULD count on them to help steer me right with outstanding free meal service, shower and  bedbug free while I remained SAFE.

I stayed here once and I got COVID-19. The place is not kept clean. They don't wash the floors. They don't wash the handles. These people are homeless. Committed off the streets and they're filthy. They're not requiring showers before they get in the beds. There's bed bugs. It's horrible up there.

name: Oroville Rescue Mission
address: 4250 Lincoln Blvd, Oroville, CA 95966, United States
reviews: Don't come here. Everything you own will be stolen by staff. The people saying you're good. Staff makes money off of things they steal.

This shelter is ok, but very cramped in the womens dorm. But is also very slow trying to find housing and services for the homeless. My friend is still there. She's been there 4 or 5 years. Thinking about taking her to the Jesus Center or Torres Shelter here in Chico. I got into my apartment within 6 months  after I moved to Chico County. Hopefully they can help her better.

The staff are rude and just to eat they want to subject you to a search like they are TSA they wouldn't let me eat a hot meal because I refused to remove my boots on their nasty floor. They treat everyone who walks true the door automatically like a criminal. If you need a place to stay I advise camping rather than being humiliated and talked to like your retarded or a child.

I called to help a friend who needed to stay here. I talked to three different female workers who all stated that even though the check in time was 3-5pm that they never turn anyone away and that women that need shelter can come at anytime. I show up to drop off my friend and the women who working the early day shift were super rude and kicked us off the property. I tried to explain that we called the day before and the information we were told but the women working at that time kept cutting me off, saying, I don't care what anyone said to you, get off the property. I tried to explain that my friend isn't safe on the street because she is disabled and unable to defend herself or run away from any possible predators. The lady working told me that she didn't care, that check in time is only 3-5pm and to get off the property or she would call the cops.

We were not being loud. We drove into the property in a quiet little car, no music playing or anything. We called when we got there. Got shut down and hung up on the phone first and then were sitting in the parking lot trying to figure out where to go when the women worker came out and started demanding that we left the property. That's when I tried to explain the situation and the people we previously spoke with.
Very helpful staff and they are very friendly and compassionate. They guide you on the right path by providing helpful resources.

name: Sierra Community House
address: 265 Bear St, Kings Beach, CA 96143, United States
reviews: We appreciate the free food services on Wednesday! This location offers food pantry shopping every week on Wednesday from 3:00-4:30pm. Bring a reusable shopping bag to carry your items. The staff is helpful with smiling faces.

Extremely horrible. So many broken promises. So many lies from staff members. Complete disregard for my health and safety. Attempted to manipulate me concerning a persona legal issue. I ended up doing everything on my own. I had to leave for my own mental well-being. I was neglected as well as talked over and ignored. They can't help people recover their identification, they can't help people flee from abusive situations, and they cannot provide access for people who need urgent medical care. If you due to unfortunate circumstances loose identification because of homelessness, arson, abandonment, ect., you will not be able to recover this critical information through safe alliance.  If you need expensive medical treatment do not trust safe alliance to deliver on this either. They have failed to help me in the most basic ways and have cost me so much time in trying to get back up on my feet. I've been done with safe alliance for a long time and do not wish to continue at all. By the way- the food distribution center actually distributes mostly GMO foods with the exception of only one or two Non GMO food items per delivery (I said this because they even lied to me about this).

Wonderful services and the staff always happy to help. I had to flee my home due to domestic violence and a friend referred me here. I was cared and assisted until I was able to be on my own. I am really grateful. They helped me with legal help, food and resources.
Great organization!

name: Connecting Point
address: 208 Sutton Way, Grass Valley, CA 95945, United States
reviews:
211 has always been so helpful and a great resource whenever needed.  We are so blessed to have them as a resource for multiple situations.  Their staff are excellent and provide whatever assistance is necessary.  Thank you all for your exemplary service!

Thank You,

Linda
Great resource for families and individuals. The receptionist, Karen, is so kind and has such beautiful energy. The entire staff there is always so helpful and never makes you feel judged.
Great experience. They were very helpful!
I just called this place, asking about info regarding the IHSS registry and the person on the phone was very rude and indignant. I am hoping i can find another source.
It's a perfect place to work learn school supportive of workers and people with disability children as well. Love this place. Great

name: Lighthouse Rescue Mission
address: 111 W Kern Ave, Tulare, CA 93274, United States
reviews: It is an amazing place if you desire change. Even if you just need to pick yourself up n start over.. Staff is so supportive. I've tryed other things but from the directors to the sisters here. It's not by accident that we are where we are.. We truly are blessed

My entire life has been a struggle. Until I found the lighthouse. After 23 years in prison I didn't know what the future held for me. With the help and dedication of the lighthouse family I am now employed and building my life. I feel like a red carpet is being rolled out in front of me and all I have to do is walk it. There is something truly special about this place. They will help you if you are ready to help yourself. Special thanks to Junior and Karen. Awesome people. God bless them and all of you.

Faith based program with a few different sites that help men women and children. This place is a blessing to the homeless community and its definitely a privilege to know the men and women dedicated to God that work here. They are doing God's work.
They offer overnight shelter,  men's workforce,women's workforce, room and Board, academy program,thrift store and recycling center all within a 4 block radius.

These people are very rude. They allow alot of harassment to go on there. They show favoritism there which is why my daughter and I almost got kicked out. One of the staff members that worked there was very unprofessional as a worker. She was the one that said we would have to leave if I didn't stop responding to being harassed.

They're really nice people that really they're a blessing to help everybody and anyone they can I thank the Lord for them cuz they gave me a place to stay so if you're ever going on your luck go to them and they will help you out with the place to stay showers Junior that runs it God has really blessed you I have no negative things to say about this place
The gentleman auggie that runs it is a really nice good Christian man he cares for the people I would help him out anyway I can he's helped me and I would help him so whoever opened it for the people that need us to have a place to stay in and a good meal I'll give you a good man I think the Lord for him

name: Central California Family Crisis
address: 211 N Main St, Porterville, CA 93257, United States
reviews: I would like to thank all the staff at the shelter. I grew & was able to get back on my feet into my own 3 bd room home although I wasn't able to stay living in Porterville I was still able to move into a home in Fresno county. Thank you all for your support & direction to being a mother who can change things for my children.... Sincerely Rosalinda (Linda) G

Excellent customer service, always kind and detail-oriented, the front desk seems to know exactly what I need every time. I cannot find any reason to complain about this agency, except that there aren't enough organizations that provide the same services to assist individuals with the same type of need.

This place is a joke. Took a class for a year. Was pretty much just show up. Jump around go home, aside from that my kid's mother came here when we were going to child custody and they wrote a long fault statement for her about me stating I was a drug user abuser and all was on my record and let's just say when we showed up to court aside from the judge telling my kids' mother how ridiculous her false statements were since I had no such record ultimately my kids' mother was not given anything she asked for and I would granted pretty much everything so anyone seeking help I would recommend finding a more suitable agency because all you'll find here is stupidity if we're being honest
I have to say that I learned so much during my time here. I also want to say thank you to Virginia for hearing me out. I send you a warm embrace.
The ladies at the front desk have the worst attitude and they should be the ones taking anger management classes SO RUDE !!

name: Visalia Rescue Mission
address: 741 N Santa Fe St, Visalia, CA 93292, United States
